Job Title: Product Analyst – Digital Experience

Position Overview: National Veterinary Associates (NVA) has an exciting opportunity to join our growing team. We’re seeking someone who is passionate about technology and experience design, with a passion for animal health, to help us modernize the digital experience for tens of thousands of clients and clinicians.

As a Product Analyst, you will help ensure a fact-driven approach to the modernization of our client and clinician digital experience, bringing together user research, industry research, and data. Your work will range from gathering and synthesizing initial product requirements, to ongoing client support as we roll out and troubleshoot additional features and product extensions. You will manage the backlog, and – alongside the broader team – will have a key operational role in scaling our technologies.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology, understanding user needs, and will also have strong internal stakeholder communication skills. From maintaining product documentation to analysis, this role plays an important role in product success and user engagement.

The Product Analyst will report to a Sr. Product Manager within our Digital Experience team.

Key Responsibilities

Analysis: Conduct thorough analysis of business and product processes and requirements through market and primary user research. Utilize data analytics tools and methodologies to analyze user behavior, product performance, and market trends.Project Management: Develop and maintain detailed project plans and timelines to ensure successful product implementations. Create and maintain clear product requirements with UAT steps to guide product implementation.Product & Feature Analysis: Analyze client adoption of new product features. Work with clients to clear any blockers.Performance Metrics: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the success of products and features against experience and financial indicators.Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including operations, designers, engineers, and marketing, to provide data-driven insights and recommendations.Product Testing: Participate in product testing and feedback sessions, ensuring products meet user expectations and quality standards.Reporting: Generate regular reports and dashboards to communicate product performance and trends to stakeholders.Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for product optimization and enhancements based on data analysis and user feedback.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree4 years of experience in product analysis or business analysis.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent communication skills and ability to explain the technical to non-technical stakeholders.Detail-oriented with a problem-solving mindset.Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, cross-functional environment.

Key Expectations

Work remotely in the United States, with ability to travel up to 10% of the time.Passion and understanding of the human-animal bond.Quick learner, with a passion for new technology.Strong problem solver.Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust.Not afraid to “roll up the sleeves” and seeks to go outside comfort zone to learn – pushes teams to do the same.Empowers others to fail, learn, and grow.Experimental mindset to drive innovation.

Why You’ll Love Working Here

The people. You will be surrounded by talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders/teams - people you will be proud to work with and who also have fun.

The business. We work for the love of animals and the people who love them. We enjoy driving a successful business while living our values and our “why”.

The opportunity. Your days and projects will offer variety with the opportunity to gain operational, cross-functional, and executive leadership exposure as a trusted internal business partner. You would have the opportunity to help build and shape a fast-growing, global company within a high-growth, exciting industry.

Title: Director of Product Analytics
Description:
WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all.

Our Team

Today WW is undertaking a full-scale digital transformation, and the Data Team is in a crucial position to shape the future of our business and products. Leveraging tens of billions of data points per year, we produce insights that enable WW to better serve our millions of members worldwide.

At WW, the Data Team has a significant seat at the table. We report directly to the CEO and are equal partners with our peers in Product, Engineering, Marketing, Finance, and beyond. There is an authentic appetite for data-informed decision making across the company, and our role is to educate and empower stakeholders by leading with transparency and expanding our stakeholders’ understanding, often of deeply technical concepts.

Your Role

We are looking for a passionate, impact driven analytics leader who is excited to join a small, tightly knit org and drive a data-first culture across WW.

In this role, you will be at the forefront of WW strategy, collaborating with business and product leaders to optimize member success and business health. You’ll lead a small team that primarily supports the Product function, including traditional Product Management, Product Growth, and Member Experience. You’ll design and analyze experiments, develop ad hoc analysis to support strategic product initiatives, define and monitor performance KPIs, and drive Data+Product excellence by identifying and executing bespoke research initiatives. If you have an idea, explore it! 

You will also partner closely with other Data Team leaders. Over the last year we acquired a new company, launched a new data warehouse on top of Snowflake, launched new billing and subscription systems, and changed how we process data. You will be a key partner – working with Analytics and Data Warehouse Engineering teams – as we continue to shape the future state of our infrastructure.

We are a flat organization where everyone rolls up their sleeves. Our leaders operate as player-coaches, and this role is no different. All members of our team – from the Chief Data Officer to our interns – write SQL, perform analysis, and share findings that move the business forward.

Key Responsibilities

Team Leadership


Encourage early, frequent collaboration & peer review so we work with agility, fail fast, and learn more.Create processes and safe spaces that facilitate transparent, actionable feedback and individual growth opportunities (through 1:1s, surveys etc), both within your team and with key stakeholders.Define leveling expectations so that feedback is relevant to individual professional growth. 


Data Leadership


Collaborate with other Data leaders to sequence initiatives, understand each others’ roadmaps, and share knowledge.Seek efficiencies and reduce single points of failure across Product Analytics. Work with Data Warehouse Engineering and Data Science teams to build our common data stack and limit duplication of work. Work with large data sets using tools like Python, DBT, and Looker.Socialize product experience metrics throughout the organization.


Stakeholder Management


Tactfully educate non-technical stakeholders about complex technical concepts. Be accountable for the support and success of our stakeholders, leveraging our team to the fullest to ensure our partners receive a top-flight work product.Act as an escalation point for stakeholders across the business.Prioritize & triage incoming initiatives for your team. Support Product and Executive leaders as analytics needs emerge. 


People Management & Mentoring


Drive technical excellence by acting as the final pass for code and analytics review.Lead from the front when fires erupt! Roll up your sleeves, help solve problems, and provide air cover for your team. Prioritize team development via regular 1:1s and coaching opportunities.Empower your team to innovate and take big bites. Elevate your team members while remaining accountable for their work product. You are responsible for the quality of their work, but we strive for an independent and empowered team. This is a fine balance to walk!Be a player-coach, leading by example, demonstrating technical excellence, and bringing others along for the ride


About You


You’re an impact driven manager. We focus on empathy, ownership, and growth – not time cards. You’ve managed managers and developed colleagues. You are excited by the opportunity to elevate your team(s).You have experience collaborating with product managers (software/apps) and an interest in building relationships with senior product leaders.You’re business minded, results oriented, and ground your work in the overarching company strategy. You are a SQL expert, and you’re comfortable with R or Scientific Python.You have deep experience with A/B testing design and analysis.You have experience creating and evangelizing KPIs.You’re comfortable with visualization software (Looker, Tableau, etc).You have experience working with Github. You are energized by the opportunity to help people around the world live healthier lives. 


The WW Data Team practices a member-first mindset and prioritizes initiatives based on impact. If you thrive in collaborative settings, appreciate the opportunity to operate at different altitudes, lead from the front, and believe in results-based accountability, then we would love to talk to you.

Base salary may vary depending on, but not limited to: skills, experience, and location. Base Salary $190,000/yr to $240,000/yr

At WW, it is our priority to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are committed as individuals, as an organization, and as fellow humans, to advocate for and support our employees, our members, and our communities. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Health Product Filing Analyst
Description:
Imagine taking the next step in your career where you can bring your expertise and knowledge to shape and influence the growth of an exciting, cutting-edge insurance company. Teammates depend on you to guide them with your knowledge of the compliance and regulatory environment in the Health and Medicare insurance space.

About The Role

In this role, you are the expert in product regulatory filings for Health and Medicare Supplement products. You will work with our pricing, legal and corporate compliance teams to ensure that our products meet regulatory standards established by state jurisdictions. You will also work with external vendors to monitor and approve the filings they submit on our behalf. As part of the Insurance Product Strategy team, you will have lots of opportunities to do regulatory research, such as searching for competitor filings and analyzing new regulation, to help guide strategy and prioritization for our Health insurance lines. You will also work closely with Life filing teammates to stay in sync on common business processes.

Key Accountabilities

Be the Medicare Supplement compliance subject matter expert, as the source of truth for understanding Med Supp product compliance on a nationwide basis.Review marketing material to ensure product information is communicated accurately and in compliance with federal and state requirements. Support Medicare Supplement compliance policies and procedures in alignment with CMS regulations and guidance, assigned through Reg Ed.Collaborate with internal and external parties on product changes, such as re-rating, new product introduction and platform enhancements.Perform regulatory research to understand competitor filings and changes in regulation, working with Legal and Compliance to arrive at decisions to ensure compliant business practices.

About The Team

Become a part of a growing and dynamic entrepreneurial team within the established Swiss Re Group. iptiQ is a start-up unit, established to provide innovative protection solutions directly to consumers. Our team delivers the coordination, infrastructure and competences that are key to driving forward this new business, working closely with our partners and clients. Our mission is to reduce the protection gap by simplifying life insurance and making it more accessible to people. Our motto is "now life is easier for everyone". For us this means making life insurance easier to sell, to buy and to trust.

About You

You are thoughtful and thorough in your approach to your work. You are able to dive deep into regulatory research and come up with recommendations that are relatable to business stakeholders. You are excited about contributing to change the status quo in the insurance industry by joining a company that is on the path to leading-edge modernization.

Essentials

5 years relevant professional work experience.Knowledge of Medicare Supplement insurance regulation required.Ability to multi-task and manage multiple deliverables and deliver quality work within agreed upon deadlines.Excellent verbal and written communication skills by your ability to present information effectively.

Nice to haves

Bachelor's Degree.Experience working in a cross-functional business environment with ability to work closely with both internal and external business partners.Knowledge of RegEd.Knowledge of product compliance for other Health lines (Ancillary/Supplemental).

Description HTML:
Job Title: Skincare Product Analyst, Latin America

Company: Parfums Christian Dior

Location: Role based in Miami, FL

MAIN JOB OBJECTIVE:

The PCD Skincare Product Analyst will support Export and Subsidiaries teams to execute the product strategy & 360 local adaptation in line with the WW guidelines while considering regional needs and opportunities.

Constant category, product & market analysis to identify opportunities for growth and MS conquest.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Marketing Strategy:

Adaptation and execution of the Skincare marketing plan

  • For export:
  • Skincare Product analysis (sell-in & sell-out) for the key export countries to understand trends, identify opportunities, and make recommendations.
  • Participate in defining novelty’s potentials, product assortments and discontinuations.
  • Execution of the marketing plan per country together with Area Managers and Brand Managers considering their specificities.
  • For subsidiaries:
  • Participate in the coordination of the marketing plan and the product strategy: potentials, SO ambition & 360 plans of the three subsidiaries.
  • Detailed analysis with Marketing Manager to generate recommendations for local product strategy (Pricing, assortment, competitor’s catalog, and best sellers).
  • Development of customized 360 launch plans: execution guidelines, follow-up, and reports.
  • Work together with Visual Merchandising, E-business, PR, Education, Retail, and CRM teams to ensure a clear understanding of the material available and additional opportunities to support the launches in each market.
  • Work with Education and Retail team all the Cabins, Services and Beauty classes strategy for the region.
  • Work closely with Central teams for all specific needs.
  • Present the marketing plan to various audiences – internal teams, retailers, and distributors during sales seminars.
  • Analyze the skincare star launches performance with follow-up throughout the year.
  • Work together with the Marketing Manager to propose action plans to sustain key franchises (Capture and Prestige) in line with the regional strategy.

Trade Marketing

  • Lead the conception, planning, implementation, analysis, and optimization of all Skincare events in the region, considering opportunities and challenges, and focusing on clear objectives and profitability.
  • Prepare all Skincare event guidelines for proper implementation in POS, including processes and logistics of the event, Training, CRM, PR, Digital, Advertising & Media.
  • Plan, organize, and lead calls with distributors or subsidiaries before each event programmed in the calendar to provide helpful tools and recommendations to ensure proper execution of the events per the brand guidelines.
  • Work alongside CRM & Retail department to maximize client potential and continue to increase desirability in all events and trade tactics.
  • Strategically organize event calendar for Skincare based on Dior launches and sell-out analysis for each client to provide insight on their yearly event strategy.
  • Create and compile event and best practice reports which include KPIs, ROI, photos, client feedback, and qualitative and quantitative data.
  • Manage freelancer & local Skincare expert's agenda / budget for events.

Budget Management

  • Ensure the reservations for all Skincare launches, and basic materials for the Export region including products, testers, soft merchandising, GWP’s, sampling (total POSM) and the alignment with the axe yearly budget.
  • Work in Export in the Menu file in collaboration with the Commercial and Forecasting team.
  • Assist the Marketing Manager in the preparation of budget revisions (2 or 3 times per year)
  • Work the BNP for Export countries.

PRINCIPAL SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED:

  • At least 2 years of experience in Operational Marketing, preferably in the luxury industry.
  • Outgoing, self-motivated, likes working in a collaborative team environment and excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Strong organization & time management skills and able to handle multiple deadlines and prioritize accordingly.
  • Problem solver who can incorporate new learnings into existing plans and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Excellent communication, presentation & public speaking skills.
  • Very comfortable with analyzing numeric figures.
  • Passion, curiosity & interest in the beauty and luxury industry.
  • Must be “hands-on” and get involved with the details.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and often changing environment with little supervision.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs (Excel, Word, PPT) and ability to create impactful presentations.
  • “Can-do” positive attitude driven approach, flexible with demands and changes in business environment.
  • Speaks fluent Spanish and English. French is a plus.
